result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan G. McChesney

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:01 AM Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney in court.  Attorney Mark Gumz appeared by phone for Jonathan G. McChesney.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz is appearing for Atty Middleton today.  Atty Gumz asks for another status date be set or a Prelim be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:51 PM Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant as to why he failed to appear at the last court date.  Defendant had some things come up and lost track of it.

Atty Juech requests a $250 cash bond with the same conditions.
Defendant doesn't have the money.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Status hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.

3:50 PM Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney not in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video for Jonathan G. McChesney. 
Atty Middleton is unsure where his client is at this time but does have good contact with him; requests a stay if a warrant is issued.
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney appeared by phone.  Attorney Allison Borcheim appeared by video with intern Alex Mett for Jonathan G. McChesney. 
Mr. Mett asks for another status.  Atty Burdon states that time limits were waived and an offer was extended to the defendant; he will send one to Atty Middleton.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status hearing on August 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney appeared by phone.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video for Jonathan G. McChesney. 
Atty Middleton states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Middleton advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Middleton waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription *No possession of any Drug Paraphernalia

3:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan G. McChesney appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Catherine Dorl appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint  Court confirms address and phone. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $100 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Dorl objects to the cash bond and asks for a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
